abstract: Wireless companies and Federal Communications Commission reach agreement to alert users when they are nearing their limit for voice, text or data services, and are in danger of being charged extra; agreement, which will begin within a year, binds all members of the industry's largest trade group, virtually covering all 300 million wireless users in America.
snippet: Wireless carriers have been losing good will with users bitter about the sometimes exorbitant charges resulting from overuse of what has become a consumer staple — the cellphone.
lead_paragraph: Wireless carriers have been losing good will with users bitter about the sometimes exorbitant charges resulting from overuse of what has become a consumer staple — the cellphone.

headline.main: Wireless Users Will Get Alerts on Excess Use
headline.print_headline: Wireless Users Will Get Alerts On Excess Use
headline.seo: F.C.C. and Wireless Carriers Agree to Alerts to Fight ‘Bill Shock’
